summary: Project now includes an Art Gallery upload flow (with public vs "my art" visibility) and a Virtual Pet Hub featuring a fully 3D pet lifecycle and interactions.
architectural_notes: User requests focused changes only; avoid impacting other features/CRUD when implementing updates.
known_issues: Art Gallery upload fails with error: "Do not know how to serialize a BigInt".

existing_features.title: In Virtual Pet Hub, when the user presses the “Feed Pet” button, make the pet display perform an immediate, clearly visible reaction (not just a toast). The reaction must be shown in the pet visual area and should last briefly (e.g., ~1–2 seconds) before returning to idle.

In Virtual Pet Hub, when the user presses the “Play” button, make the pet display perform an immediate, clearly visible reaction distinct from the Feed reaction (not just a toast). The reaction must be shown in the pet visual area and should last briefly (e.g., ~1–2 seconds) before returning to idle.

Ensure Feed/Play reactions do not block normal usage: buttons must remain functional and the page must not crash if actions are triggered repeatedly. If a user triggers an action while an animation is already playing, either restart the animation cleanly or queue/replace it in a predictable way.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix Art Gallery upload error: "Do not know how to serialize a BigInt" so users can instantly upload artwork and choose public vs "my art" visibility.
Support uploading up to 100MB files in the Art Gallery.
Virtual Pet Hub: pet starts as an egg, user can hatch into a dog or cat, and it slowly ages over time.
Make the Virtual Pet Hub pet 100% 3D.
Virtual Pet Hub: when user presses Feed or Play, the 3D pet should perform visible actions/animations (respond to interaction).
